medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute renal failure with severe abdominal pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient developed severe abdominal pain while at a wedding 2 days prior to admission. He had been experiencing near nightly abdominal pain for about 2 months, which became constant and worsening over the past 2 days. The pain does not radiate and is associated with occasional nausea but not related to food intake. Reports chronic chills without fevers, and increased bilateral swelling despite diuretics.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, Hypercholesterolemia, Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus, Obstructive Sleep Apnea, Basal cell carcinoma (pre-treatment), Squamous cell carcinoma in situ (post-treatment), GERD, Degenerative L5-S1, Sinusitis, Internal hemorrhoids, Thrush, CMV positive, BKV positive, EBV antibody positive, Effusion with tamponade post-pericardiocentesis, End-state renal disease, Polycystic kidney disease status post-transplant.
medical_history.family_history: Lupus (mother), Ovarian cancer (sister), Unknown conditions in grandfather and father.
